abstract: Populates the toolbar or navigation bar with the specified items, allowing for user customization.

declaration.code: nonisolated func toolbar<Content>(id: String, @ToolbarContentBuilder content: () -> Content) -> some View where Content : CustomizableToolbarContent

overview:
## Discussion

Use this modifier when you want to allow the user to customize the components and layout of elements in the toolbar. The toolbar modifier expects a collection of toolbar items which you can provide either by supplying a collection of views with each view wrapped in a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarItem].

The example below creates a view that represents each [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarItem] along with an ID that uniquely identifies the toolbar item to the customization editor:



In macOS you can enable menu support for toolbar customization by adding a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToolbarCommands] instance to a scene using the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Scene/commands(content:)] scene modifier:

When you add the toolbar commands, the system adds a menu item to your app’s main menu to provide toolbar customization support. This is in addition to the ability to Control-click on the toolbar to open the toolbar customization editor.

items.description: Conforming types represent items that can be placed in various locations in a customizable toolbar.
items.name: CustomizableToolbarContent

items.description: The customization behavior of customizable toolbar content.
items.name: ToolbarCustomizationBehavior

items.description: Options that influence the default customization behavior of customizable toolbar content.
items.name: ToolbarCustomizationOptions

items.description: The behavior of a search field in a toolbar.
items.name: SearchToolbarBehavior

title: toolbar(id:content:)
